sourcesContent:
import React, { Component, useState, useEffect } from 'react' import GetRequest from '../Utility/HttpRequests' import Sun from '@mui/icons-material/WbSunny' import Cloud from '@mui/icons-material/Cloud' import Rain from '@mui/icons-material/WaterDrop' import Thunder from '@mui/icons-material/Thunderstorm' import Snow from '@mui/icons-material/Snowshoeing' const WeatherCodes = { ClearSky: 0, MainlyClear: 1, PartlyCloud: 2, Overcast: 3, Fog: 45, RimeFog: 46, DrizzleLight: 51, DrizzleModerate: 52, DrizzleDense: 53, FreezingDrizzleLight: 56, FreezingDrizzleDense: 57, RainSlight: 61, RainModerate: 63, RainHeavy: 65, FreezingRainLight: 66, FreezingRainHeavy: 67, SnowSlight: 71, SnowModerate: 73, SnowHeavy: 75, SnowGrains: 77, RainShowersSlight: 80, RainShowersModerate: 81, RainShowersViolent: 82, SnowShowerSlight: 85, SnowShowerHeavy: 86, Thunderstorm: 95, ThuderstormSlightHail: 96, ThunderstormHeavyHail: 99 }; class Weather extends React.Component { constructor() { const [weather, setWeather] = useState(null); useEffect(() => { GetRequest("https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=46.253468&longitude=16.615731¤t_weather=true&hourly=temperature_2m,relativehumidity_2m,windspeed_10m") .then(response => { setWeather(response.data); }) .catch(error => { console.error(error); }); }, []); return render(weather); } } function ParseWeatherCode(weatherCode) { return Object.keys(WeatherCodes).find(key => WeatherCodes[key] === weatherCode); } function render(weather) { return (

WEATHER

This is an example of a live weather data retrieval.

{weather && (

Latitude: {weather['latitude']}

Longitude: {weather['longitude']}

Time: {weather['current_weather']['time']}

Temperature: {weather['current_weather']['temperature']} C

Wind speed: {weather['current_weather']['windspeed']} km/h

Weather code: {weather['current_weather']['weathercode']}

)}
) } export default Weather
